intro: Euphrasia latifolia var. obtusata, commonly known as the broad-leaved eyebright, is a flowering plant belonging to the Scrophulariaceae family. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a hairy texture, and it is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia. This variant is distinguished by its rounded leaf tips, which set it apart from other eyebright species.
